name: honeycomb
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing honeycomb cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`honeycombio` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/honeycombio/terraform-provider-honeycombio).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing honeycomb cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/honeycombio/terraform-provider-honeycombio)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-honeycomb` repo](https://github.com/thejokersthief/pulumi-honeycomb/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-honeycombio` repo](https://github.com/honeycombio/terraform-provider-honeycombio/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/honeycombio/terraform-provider-honeycombio)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-honeycomb` repo](https://github.com/thejokersthief/pulumi-honeycomb/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-honeycombio` repo](https://github.com/honeycombio/terraform-provider-honeycombio/issues).

debug.description: Enable the API client's debug logs. By default, a `TF_LOG` setting of debug or higher will enable this.

caption.description: A description of the query that will be displayed on the board. Supports markdown.

dataset.description: The dataset this query is associated with.
dataset.deprecationMessage: Board Queries no longer require the dataset as they rely on the provided Query ID's dataset.

graphSettings.description:
A map of boolean toggles to manages the settings for this query's graph on the board.
If a value is unspecified, it is assumed to be false.
Currently supported toggles are:

queryAnnotationId.description: The ID of the Query Annotation to associate with this query.

queryId.description: The ID of the Query to run.

queryStyle.description: How the query should be displayed within the board, either `graph` (the default), `table` or `combo`.

hideMarkers.description: Disable the overlay of Markers on the graph.

logScale.description: Set the graph's Y axis to Log scale.

omitMissingValues.description: Enable interpolatation between datapoints when the interveneing time buckets have no matching events.

overlaidCharts.description: See [Graph Settings](https://docs.honeycomb.io/working-with-your-data/graph-settings/) in the documentation for more information on any individual setting.

stackedGraphs.description: Enable the display of groups as stacked colored area under their line graphs.

utcXaxis.description: Set the graph's X axis to UTC.

id.description: The ID of an already existing recipient. Should not be used in combination with `type` and `target`.

notificationDetails.description:
a block of additional details to send along with the notification. The only supported option currently is `pagerduty_severity` which has a default value of `critical` but can be set to one of `info`, `warning`, `error`, or `critical` and must be used in combination with a PagerDuty recipient.

Type      | Target
----------|-------------------------
email     | an email address
pagerduty | _N/A_
slack     | name of the channel
webhook   | name of the webhook

target.description: Target of the recipient, this has another meaning depending on the type of recipient (see the table below). Should not be used in combination with `id`.

type.description: The type of the recipient, allowed types are `email`, `pagerduty`, `slack` and `webhook`. Should not be used in combination with `id`.

column.description: The column to apply the operator to, not needed with `COUNT` or `CONCURRENCY`.

op.description: The operator to apply, see the supported list of calculation operators at [Calculation Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#calculation-operators).

column.description: The column to apply the filter to.

op.description: The operator to apply, see the supported list of filter operators at [Filter Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#filter-operators). Not all operators require a value.

value.description: The value used for the filter. Not needed if op is `exists`, `not-exists`, `in` or `not-in`. Mutually exclusive with the other `value_*` options.

valueBoolean.description:
Deprecated: use 'value' instead. The value used for the filter when the column is a boolean. Mutually exclusive with `value` and the other `value_*` options.

> **NOTE** The type of the filter value should match with the type of the column. To determine the type of a column visit the dataset settings page, all the columns and their type are listed under _Schema_. This provider will not be able to detect invalid combinations.

> **NOTE** Filter op `in` and `not-in` expect an array of strings as value. Use the `value_string` attribute and pass the values in single string separated by `,` without additional spaces (similar to the query builder in the UI). For example: the list `foo`, `bar` becomes `foo,bar`.
valueBoolean.deprecationMessage: Use of attribute `value_boolean` is discouraged and will fail to plan if using 'false'. Use of `value` is encouraged.

valueFloat.description: Deprecated: use 'value' instead. The value used for the filter when the column is a float. Mutually exclusive with `value` and the other `value_*` options.
valueFloat.deprecationMessage: Use of attribute `value_float` is discouraged and will fail to plan if using '0'. Use of `value` is encouraged.

valueInteger.description: Deprecated: use 'value' instead. The value used for the filter when the column is an integer. Mutually exclusive with `value` and the other `value_*` options.
valueInteger.deprecationMessage: Use of attribute `value_integer` is discouraged and will fail to plan if using '0'. Use of `value` is encouraged.

valueString.description: Deprecated: use 'value' instead. The value used for the filter when the column is a string. Mutually exclusive with `value` and the other `value_*` options.
valueString.deprecationMessage: Use of attribute `value_string` is discouraged and will fail to plan if using the empty string. Use of `value` is encouraged.

calculateOp.description: The calculation operator to apply, supports all of the [Calculation Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#calculation-operators) with the exception of `HEATMAP`.

column.description: The column to apply the `calculate_op` to, not needed with `COUNT` or `CONCURRENCY`.

op.description: The operator to apply to filter the query results. One of `=`, `!=`, `>`, `>=`, `<`, or `<=`.

value.description:
The value used with `op`. Currently assumed to be a number.

> **NOTE** A having term's `column`/`calculate_op` pair must have a corresponding `calculation`. There can be multiple `having` blocks for the same `column`/`calculate_op` pair.

column.description: Either a column present in `breakdown` or a column to `op` applies to.

op.description: The calculation operator to apply, see the supported list of calculation operators at [Calculation Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#calculation-operators).

order.description: The sort direction, if set must be `ascending` or `descending`.

name.description: The name of the detail field to filter by. Allowed values are `address`, `channel`, `name`, `integration_name`, and `url`.

value.description: The value of the detail field to match on.

valueRegex.description:
A regular expression string to apply to the value of the detail field to match on.

> **Note** one of `value` or `value_regex` is required.

name.description: The name of the detail field to filter by. Allowed values are `address`, `channel`, `name`, `integration_name`, and `url`.

value.description: The value of the detail field to match on.

valueRegex.description:
A regular expression string to apply to the value of the detail field to match on.

> **Note** one of `value` or `value_regex` is required.

id.description: The ID of an already existing recipient. Should not be used in combination with `type` and `target`.

notificationDetails.description:
a block of additional details to send along with the notification. The only supported option currently is `pagerduty_severity` which has a default value of `critical` but can be set to one of `info`, `warning`, `error`, or `critical` and must be used in combination with a PagerDuty recipient.

Type      | Target
----------|-------------------------
email     | an email address
marker    | name of the marker
pagerduty | _N/A_
slack     | name of the channel
webhook   | name of the webhook

target.description: Target of the trigger recipient, this has another meaning depending on the type of recipient (see the table below). Should not be used in combination with `id`.

type.description: The type of the trigger recipient, allowed types are `email`, `marker`, `pagerduty`, `slack` and `webhook`. Should not be used in combination with `id`.

op.description: The operator to apply, allowed threshold operators are `>`, `>=`, `<`, and `<=`.

value.description: The value to be used with the operator.

provider.description:
The provider type for the honeycombio package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

debug.description: Enable the API client's debug logs. By default, a `TF_LOG` setting of debug or higher will enable this.
Enable the API client's debug logs. By default, a `TF_LOG` setting of debug or higher will enable this.

boardUrl.description: The URL to the board in the Honeycomb UI.

columnLayout.description: the number of columns to layout on the board, either `multi` (the default) or `single`. Only `visual` style boards (see below) have a column layout.

description.description: Description of the board. Supports markdown.

name.description: Name of the board.

queries.description: Zero or more configurations blocks (described below) with the queries of the board.

style.description: How the board should be displayed in the UI, either `list` (the default) or `visual`.

columnLayout.description: the number of columns to layout on the board, either `multi` (the default) or `single`. Only `visual` style boards (see below) have a column layout.

description.description: Description of the board. Supports markdown.

name.description: Name of the board.

queries.description: Zero or more configurations blocks (described below) with the queries of the board.

style.description: How the board should be displayed in the UI, either `list` (the default) or `visual`.

queries.description: Zero or more configurations blocks (described below) with the queries of the board.

dataset.description: The dataset this burn alert is associated with.

exhaustionMinutes.description: The amount of time, in minutes, remaining before the SLO's error budget will be exhausted and the alert will fire.

recipients.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the alert fires.

sloId.description: ID of the SLO this burn alert is associated with.

dataset.description: The dataset this SLO is created in. Must be the same dataset as the SLI unless the SLI's dataset is `"__all__"`.

description.description: A description of the SLO's intent and context.

name.description: The name of the SLO.

sli.description:
The alias of the Derived Column that will be used as the SLI to indicate event success.
The derived column used as the SLI must be in the same dataset as the SLO. Additionally,
the column evaluation should consistently return nil, true, or false, as these are the only valid values for an SLI.

targetPercentage.description: The percentage of qualified events that you expect to succeed during the `time_period`.

timePeriod.description: The time period, in days, over which your SLO will be evaluated.

channel.description: The Slack channel or username to send the notification to. Must begin with `#` or `@`.
The Slack channel or username to send the notification to. Must begin with `#` or `@`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering SlackRecipient resources.

channel.description: The Slack channel or username to send the notification to. Must begin with `#` or `@`.

alertType.description: The frequency for the alert to trigger. (`on_change` is the default behavior, `on_true` can also be selected)

dataset.description: The dataset this trigger is associated with.

description.description: Description of the trigger.

disabled.description: The state of the trigger. If true, the trigger will not be run. Defaults to false.

frequency.description: The interval (in seconds) in which to check the results of the querys calculation against the threshold. This value must be divisible by 60, between 60 and 86400 (between 1 minute and 1 day), and not be more than 4 times the query's duration. Defaults to 900 (15 minutes).

name.description: Name of the trigger.

queryId.description: The ID of the Query that the Trigger will execute.

recipients.description:
Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the trigger fires.

> **NOTE** The query used in a Trigger must follow a strict subset: the query must contain *exactly one* calcuation and may only contain `calculation`, `filter`, `filter_combination` and `breakdowns` fields.
The query's duration (`time_range` in the specification) cannot be more than four times the trigger frequency. For example: if using the default query `time_range` of `7200` the lowest `frequency` for a trigger is `1800`.

threshold.description: A configuration block (described below) describing the threshold of the trigger.

alertType.description: The frequency for the alert to trigger. (`on_change` is the default behavior, `on_true` can also be selected)

dataset.description: The dataset this trigger is associated with.

description.description: Description of the trigger.

disabled.description: The state of the trigger. If true, the trigger will not be run. Defaults to false.

frequency.description: The interval (in seconds) in which to check the results of the querys calculation against the threshold. This value must be divisible by 60, between 60 and 86400 (between 1 minute and 1 day), and not be more than 4 times the query's duration. Defaults to 900 (15 minutes).

name.description: Name of the trigger.

queryId.description: The ID of the Query that the Trigger will execute.

recipients.description:
Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the trigger fires.

> **NOTE** The query used in a Trigger must follow a strict subset: the query must contain *exactly one* calcuation and may only contain `calculation`, `filter`, `filter_combination` and `breakdowns` fields.
The query's duration (`time_range` in the specification) cannot be more than four times the trigger frequency. For example: if using the default query `time_range` of `7200` the lowest `frequency` for a trigger is `1800`.

threshold.description: A configuration block (described below) describing the threshold of the trigger.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Trigger resources.

alertType.description: The frequency for the alert to trigger. (`on_change` is the default behavior, `on_true` can also be selected)

dataset.description: The dataset this trigger is associated with.

description.description: Description of the trigger.

disabled.description: The state of the trigger. If true, the trigger will not be run. Defaults to false.

frequency.description: The interval (in seconds) in which to check the results of the querys calculation against the threshold. This value must be divisible by 60, between 60 and 86400 (between 1 minute and 1 day), and not be more than 4 times the query's duration. Defaults to 900 (15 minutes).

name.description: Name of the trigger.

queryId.description: The ID of the Query that the Trigger will execute.

recipients.description:
Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the trigger fires.

> **NOTE** The query used in a Trigger must follow a strict subset: the query must contain *exactly one* calcuation and may only contain `calculation`, `filter`, `filter_combination` and `breakdowns` fields.
The query's duration (`time_range` in the specification) cannot be more than four times the trigger frequency. For example: if using the default query `time_range` of `7200` the lowest `frequency` for a trigger is `1800`.

honeycomb:index/getDatasets:GetDatasets.description:
## # Data Source: honeycomb.GetDatasets

The datasets data source allows the datasets of an account to be retrieved.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetDatasets.

startsWith.description: Only return datasets starting with the given value.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetDatasets.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

names.description: a list of all the dataset names.

slugs.description: a list of all the dataset slugs.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetQueryResult.

dataset.description: The dataset this query is associated with.

queryJson.description: A JSON object describing the query according to the Query Specification. While the JSON can be constructed manually, it is easiest to use the honeycomb.GetQuerySpecification data source.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetQueryResult.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

queryId.description: The ID of the Query created and executed to obtain the result.

queryUrl.description: The permalink to the executed query's results.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetQuerySpecification.

breakdowns.description: A list of fields to group by.

calculations.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the calculations that should be displayed. If no calculations are specified, `COUNT` will be used.

endTime.description: The absolute end time of the query in Unix Time (= seconds since epoch).

filterCombination.description: How to combine multiple filters, either `AND` (default) or `OR`.

filters.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the filters that should be applied.

granularity.description:
The time resolution of the querys graph, in seconds. Valid values must be in between the querys time range /10 at maximum, and /1000 at minimum.

> **NOTE** It is not allowed to specify all three of `time_range`, `start_time` and `end_time`. For more details about specifying time windows, check [Query specification: A caveat on time](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#a-caveat-on-time).

havings.description: Zero or more filters used to restrict returned groups in the query result.

limit.description: The maximum number of query results, must be between 1 and 1000.

orders.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) describing how to order the query results. Each term must appear in either `calculation` or `breakdowns`.

startTime.description: The absolute start time of the query in Unix Time (= seconds since epoch).

timeRange.description: The time range of the query in seconds, defaults to two hours.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetQuerySpecification.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

json.description: JSON representation of the query according to the [Query Specification](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#fields-on-a-query-specification), can be used as input for other resources.

honeycomb:index/getRecipient:GetRecipien.description:
## Example Usage

<!--Start PulumiCodeChooser -->
```yaml
resources:
  exampleTrigger:
    type: honeycomb:Trigger
    properties:
      queryJson: ${exampleGetQuerySpecification.json}
      dataset: ${var.dataset}
      threshold:
        op: '>'
        value: 1000
      recipients:
        - type: email
          target: hello@example.com
        - id: ${slack.id}
variables:
  slack:
    fn::invoke:
      Function: honeycomb:GetRecipient
      Arguments:
        type: slack
        detailFilter:
          name: channel
          value: '#honeycomb-triggers'
  exampleGetQuerySpecification:
    fn::invoke:
      Function: honeycomb:GetQuerySpecification
      Arguments:
        calculations:
          - op: AVG
            column: duration_ms
```
<!--End PulumiCodeChooser -->

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetRecipient.

dataset.description: Deprecated: recipients are now a Team-level construct. Any provided value will be ignored.
dataset.deprecationMessage: Recipients are now a Team-level construct. The provided 'dataset' value is being ignored and should be removed.

detailFilter.description: a block to further filter recipients as described below.

target.description:
Deprecated: use `detail_filter` instead. The target of the recipient, this has another meaning depending on the type of recipient (see the table below).

Type      | Target
----------|-------------------------
email     | an email address
marker    | name of the marker
pagerduty | _N/A_
slack     | name of the channel
webhook   | name of the webhook
target.deprecationMessage: Use of 'target' has been replaced by 'detail_filter'.

type.description: The type of recipient, allowed types are `email`, `pagerduty`, `slack` and `webhook`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetRecipient.

address.description: The email recipient's address -- if of type `email`.

channel.description: The Slack recipient's channel -- if of type `slack`.

dataset.deprecationMessage: Recipients are now a Team-level construct. The provided 'dataset' value is being ignored and should be removed.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

integrationKey.description: (Sensitive) The PagerDuty recipient's integration key -- if of type `pagerduty`.

integrationName.description: The PagerDuty recipient's inregration name -- if of type `pagerduty`.

name.description: The webhook recipient's name -- if of type `webhook`.

secret.description: (Sensitive) The webhook recipient's secret -- if of type `webhook`.

target.deprecationMessage: Use of 'target' has been replaced by 'detail_filter'.

url.description: The webhook recipient's URL - if of type `webhook`.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetRecipients.

detailFilter.description: a block to further filter recipients as described below. `type` must be set when providing a filter.

type.description: The type of recipient, allowed types are `email`, `pagerduty`, `slack` and `webhook`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetRecipients.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

ids.description: A list of all the recipient IDs found.

honeycomb:index/getTriggerRecipient:GetT.description:
## # Data Source: honeycomb.GetTriggerRecipient

Search the triggers of a dataset for a trigger recipient. The ID of the existing trigger recipient can be used when adding trigger recipients to new triggers.

> **Deprecated** Use the `honeycomb.GetRecipient` data source instead.

## Example Usage

<!--Start PulumiCodeChooser -->
```yaml
configuration:
  dataset:
    type: string
resources:
  exampleTrigger:
    type: honeycomb:Trigger
    properties:
      queryJson: ${exampleGetQuerySpecification.json}
      dataset: ${dataset}
      threshold:
        op: '>'
        value: 1000
      recipients:
        - type: email
          target: hello@example.com
        - id: ${slack.id}
variables:
  slack:
    fn::invoke:
      Function: honeycomb:GetTriggerRecipient
      Arguments:
        dataset: ${dataset}
        type: slack
        target: honeycomb-triggers
  exampleGetQuerySpecification:
    fn::invoke:
      Function: honeycomb:GetQuerySpecification
      Arguments:
        calculations:
          - op: AVG
            column: duration_ms
```
<!--End PulumiCodeChooser -->

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetTriggerRecipient.

dataset.description: Search through all triggers linked to this dataset.

target.description:
Target of the trigger, this has another meaning depending on the type of recipient (see the table below).

Type      | Target
----------|-------------------------
email     | an email address
marker    | name of the marker
pagerduty | _N/A_
slack     | name of the channel
webhook   | name of the webhook

type.description: The type of recipient, allowed types are `email`, `marker`, `pagerduty`, `slack` and `webhook`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetTriggerRecipient.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.
